goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time, which can help us optimize flight schedules.

goals.question: What is the most common origin airport?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common origin airport, which can help us optimize flight routes and schedules.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight cancellations and the proportion of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of flight distances and the frequency of flights at different distances.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', bins=50, kde=True, color='blue')
    median_delay = data['departure_delay'].median()
    plt.axvline(median_delay, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median Delay: {median_delay:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='distance', y='air_time')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Distance')
    plt.ylabel('Flight Time')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    origin_counts = data['origin_airport'].value_counts()
    sns.barplot(x=origin_counts.index, y=origin_counts.values)
    plt.xlabel('Origin Airport')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Flights')
    plt.title('What is the most common origin airport?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(title='Origin Airports', loc='upper right', labels=origin_counts.index)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    cancelled_counts = data['cancelled'].value_counts()
    labels = ['Not Cancelled', 'Cancelled']
    colors = ['#66b3ff', '#ff9999']
    plt.pie(cancelled_counts, labels=labels, colors=colors, autopct='%.2f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(labels, loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance', bins=30, kde=True, color='blue')
    median_distance = data['distance'].median()
    plt.axvline(median_distance, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median Distance: {median_distance:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight distances?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Distance')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
